next js/myntra-clone/README.md.content:
This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

## Deploy on Vercel

The easiest way to deploy your Next.js app is to use the [Vercel Platform](https://vercel.com/new?utm_medium=default-template&filter=next.js&utm_source=create-next-app&utm_campaign=create-next-app-readme) from the creators of Next.js.

Check out our [Next.js deployment documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/deploying) for more details.

replit.md.content:
# Myntra Clone - E-commerce Platform

## Overview

A full-stack e-commerce application inspired by Myntra, built with Next.js for web and React Native (Expo) for mobile. The platform features product browsing, wishlist management, shopping cart functionality, user authentication, and integrated payment processing via Razorpay. The application showcases a modern fashion retail experience with filtering, search, and order management capabilities.

**Recent Changes (October 8, 2025)**
- Migrated from Vercel to Replit environment
- Fixed Next.js 15 async headers API compatibility in session management
- Configured development server to run on port 5000 with 0.0.0.0 binding for Replit
- **NEW Authentication Features Implemented:**
  - Google SSO for sign in and signup using NextAuth.js
  - OTP-based login via SMS using Twilio (requires phone number in database)
  - Password-based login with existing JWT system
  - Forgot password functionality with email reset links
  - Dual authentication mode (password/OTP) on login page
  - Phone number is now mandatory for all signups
  - Google OAuth users are redirected to complete profile with phone number
  - OTP login only works for users with registered phone numbers
- **NEW Premium Home Page Design:**
  - Auto-rotating hero banner slider with 3 slides (5-second intervals)
  - Shop by Category section with 6 categories (Men, Women, Kids, Footwear, Accessories, Beauty)
  - Shop Sale section with 4 sale cards featuring discount badges
  - New Arrivals section with 4 latest collection cards
  - Trending Collections section with 4 curated collections
  - Top Brands carousel with 6 brand logos (Nike, Puma, Adidas, H&M, Zara, Levi's)
  - Newsletter subscription section with email capture
  - Modern color scheme: Primary #0B7FB3 (teal blue), Success #26a541 (green)
  - All buttons functional with category navigation
- **NEW Category Page with Myntra-Style Filters (FULLY FUNCTIONAL):**
  - Dynamic routing for all categories (/category/[slug])
  - Category-specific filters: Brands for fashion categories (Men, Women, Kids, Footwear, Accessories), Product Types for Beauty (Lipstick, Face Wash, Serum, Kajal, Moisturizer, Nail Polish, Compact Powder)
  - **WORKING FILTERS**: Products are now filtered by selected brands/types, price range, and colors
  - **WORKING SORTING**: Products can be sorted by price, rating, discount, popularity
  - Sort dropdown: Recommended, What's New, Popularity, Better Discount, Price (High/Low), Rating
  - Mobile-responsive with toggle filters button
  - Product grid with hover effects and functional wishlist buttons
  - **FIXED**: Wishlist icon now adds/removes items without redirecting to product page (uses stopPropagation)
  - Rating badges and discount percentages on product cards
  - "Clear All" filters functionality
  - Light theme with white sidebar and blue gradient headers
- **NEW Modern Cart Page (Myntra-Inspired):**
  - Empty cart state with image and "Hey, it feels so light!" message
  - Shopping bag layout with product cards featuring images and quantity controls
  - Price details sidebar: Total MRP, Discount, Delivery Fee, Total Amount
  - Payment method icons: Visa, Mastercard, Amex, UPI, Paytm, COD
  - Quantity increment/decrement with circular buttons
  - Individual product remove functionality
  - Free delivery for orders above 1000
  - Responsive 2-column layout (cart items + price summary)
- **NEW Wishlist Page (Myntra-Style):**
  - Header with dynamic item count (e.g., "My Wishlist 3 Items")
  - Empty state with shopping-themed image and encouraging message
  - Product grid layout with responsive columns (2-5 columns based on screen size)
  - Heart icon (filled, red) button positioned on product image to remove items
  - Product cards display: Brand name, product title, price with discount percentage
  - "MOVE TO BAG" button on each card - adds to cart and removes from wishlist
  - Hover effects and shadow transitions for enhanced UX
  - White background theme matching overall site design
  - "Continue Shopping" CTA button in empty state
- **NEW User Dashboard:**
  - Comprehensive dashboard with profile management
  - Saved addresses with full CRUD operations
  - Payment methods management (Card, UPI, Net Banking)
  - Order history with payment status tracking
  - Conditional navbar (Login/Signup when logged out, Dashboard/Logout when logged in)
  - All environment variables configured via Replit Secrets
- **Database Seeding:**
  - Comprehensive seed script at `/scripts/seed.ts`
  - 28 diverse products across 6 categories (Men: 5, Women: 5, Kids: 3, Footwear: 4, Accessories: 4, Beauty: 7)
  - Varied discount percentages (15%-70%) across products
  - Unique product images from Unsplash
  - Multiple brands per category for realistic filtering
  - Run with: `npx tsx scripts/seed.ts`
- **Payment Processing:**
  - **FIXED**: Razorpay integration now fully functional with proper error handling
  - Enhanced checkout page with proper cart structure handling (productId field)
  - Razorpay script loading verification before payment initiation
  - Improved user feedback with loading states and error messages
  - Payment verification with HMAC SHA256 signature validation
  - Order status tracking: created  paid/failed
  - Cart cleared and user redirected to orders page after successful payment
- **NEW Orders Page (Myntra-Style):**
  - Clean order history page with status badges (Confirmed/Failed/Processing)
  - Order cards showing: order number, placed date, delivery estimate, total amount
  - Product images with quantity and individual prices
  - Color-coded status indicators (green for success, red for failed, yellow for processing)
  - Estimated delivery date (5 days from order placement)
  - Empty state with encouraging message and "Start Shopping" button
  - Smooth animations on load with responsive design
- **Enhanced Search UI:**
  - Product images now display like wishlist page (previously text-only)
  - Product grid with responsive columns (2-5 columns based on screen size)
  - Product cards show: brand name, title, price, discount badges, ratings
  - Empty state with image and helpful message
  - Dynamic results count display
  - Hover effects and shadow transitions
- **Consistent Blue Theme Applied:**
  - Replaced all pink colors (#ff3f6c) with blue (#0B7FB3) across all pages
  - Updated login page: headings, buttons, tabs, links, OTP input focus, "Create account" link
  - Updated signup page: headings, buttons, links, input focus borders
  - Updated dashboard page: headings, tab navigation, edit links, input focus borders
  - Updated product page: wishlist heart icon color
  - Consistent brand color throughout: Primary #0B7FB3 (teal blue), Success #26a541 (green)
- **FIXED Authentication Issues (October 8, 2025):**
  - **Password Login Fixed**: Changed from NextAuth credentials to custom /api/auth/login endpoint
  - **Session Management Fixed**: Password login now creates proper JWT cookie that navbar recognizes
  - **OTP Cookie Path Fixed**: Added path: '/' to verify-otp endpoint cookie settings
  - **Profile Visibility Fixed**: Both password and OTP login now show profile/logout in navbar
  - **Forgot Password Fixed**: Fixed User model import error (changed from default to named export)
  - **Color Theme Updated**: Changed forgot password and reset password pages from pink to blue (#0B7FB3)
  - Authentication now uses unified JWT-based session across password and OTP login methods
- **NEW Advanced Order Management System:**
  - **Order Status Tracking**: Orders progress through statuses: paid  processing  shipped  delivered (or cancelled)
  - **Automatic Delivery Scheduling**: Delivery dates automatically set to 7 days from purchase date
  - **Order Cancellation**: Users can cancel orders with reason selection (dropdown with 5 options)
  - **Order Tracking**: Mock tracking information for testing order fulfillment flow
  - **Customer Rating System**: Users can rate delivered orders (1-5 stars with optional review)
  - **Dashboard Order Filtering**: Filter orders by status (All Orders, In Progress, Shipped, Delivered, Cancelled)
  - **Verified Purchase Reviews**: Order ratings display on product detail pages with "Verified" badge
  - **Enhanced Orders Page**: Cancel and Track buttons with modals, color-coded status indicators
  - **Review Integration**: Product pages show both regular reviews and verified purchase ratings separately

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture

**Web Application (Next.js 15)**
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router and React Server Components
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS v4 with custom design tokens for brand colors (#0B7FB3 for primary teal blue, #26a541 for success green)
- **State Management**: Client-side state using React hooks with localStorage persistence for cart and wishlist
- **Image Optimization**: Next.js Image component with remote patterns configured for Unsplash and CDN sources
- **Development Server**: Runs on port 5000 with Turbopack enabled for faster builds

**Mobile Application (React Native/Expo)**
- **Framework**: Expo SDK ~50.0 with Expo Router for file-based navigation
- **Navigation**: Tab-based layout with bottom navigation (Home, Wishlist, Cart, Profile)
- **State Management**: Custom hooks (useCart, useWishlist) with AsyncStorage persistence
- **API Communication**: Axios client with automatic token injection from AsyncStorage
- **Platform Support**: iOS, Android, and Web via Metro bundler

### Backend Architecture

**API Structure**
- **Runtime**: Next.js API Routes (App Router convention)
- **Database**: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM for schema definition and validation
- **Session Management**: JWT-based authentication with dual-mode support:
  - Web clients: HttpOnly cookies for security
  - Mobile clients: Bearer tokens via Authorization header
  - Unified session retrieval through `getSession()` helper

**Authentication Flow**
- **Multiple Authentication Methods:**
  - Google OAuth via NextAuth.js for social login
  - OTP via SMS using Twilio (6-digit code, 10-minute expiration)
  - Email/Password using bcryptjs hashing (10 salt rounds)
  - Forgot password with email reset tokens (1-hour expiration)
- JWT tokens signed with HS256 algorithm (7-day expiration configurable)
- Token verification middleware checks both cookie and Authorization header
- Logout clears cookie and invalidates client-side token storage
- NextAuth.js session management for OAuth flows

**Data Models**
- **User**: Name, email, hashed password (optional for OAuth/OTP users), phone number (optional), multiple addresses support
- **Product**: Title, description, price, images array, category, brand, rating, stock, sizes, colors, embedded reviews
- **Order**: Order number generation, user reference, items snapshot (preserves product details at purchase time), payment status tracking, Razorpay integration fields

### Payment Integration

**Razorpay Implementation**
- Order creation with amount in paise ( * 100)
- Payment verification using HMAC SHA256 signature validation
- Order status tracking: created  paid/failed
- Fallback mock implementation for development when credentials unavailable
- Client-side Razorpay checkout script loaded via Next.js Script component

### External Dependencies

**Third-Party Services**
- **Razorpay**: Payment gateway for order processing (requires RAZORPAY_KEY_ID and RAZORPAY_KEY_SECRET environment variables)
- **MongoDB**: Primary database (requires MONGODB_URI environment variable with 'ecommerce' database)
- **Unsplash**: Image CDN for product photography (configured in next.config.ts)

**Key NPM Packages**
- **Authentication**: next-auth@beta, jsonwebtoken (v9.0.2), bcryptjs (v3.0.2), @auth/mongodb-adapter
- **Communication**: twilio (SMS OTP), nodemailer (password reset emails)
- **Database**: mongoose (v8.19.0)
- **Payment**: razorpay (v2.9.6)
- **Mobile HTTP**: axios (v1.12.2)
- **Storage**: @react-native-async-storage/async-storage (v1.21.0)

**Development Tools**
- TypeScript 5 for type safety
- ESLint with Next.js config
- Tailwind CSS PostCSS integration
- Expo development tools and Metro bundler

**Environment Configuration**
Required environment variables:
- `MONGODB_URI`: MongoDB connection string
- `JWT_SECRET`: Secret key for JWT signing
- `JWT_EXPIRE`: Token expiration (default: 7d)
- `RAZORPAY_KEY_ID`: Razorpay public key
- `RAZORPAY_KEY_SECRET`: Razorpay private key
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_RAZORPAY_KEY`: Client-side Razorpay key
- `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`: NextAuth.js secret for session encryption
- `NEXTAUTH_URL`: Application URL for OAuth callbacks
- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID`: Google OAuth client ID
- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET`: Google OAuth client secret
- `TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID`: Twilio account SID for SMS
- `TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN`: Twilio authentication token
- `TWILIO_PHONE_NUMBER`: Twilio phone number for sending OTP
- `EMAIL_SERVER`: SMTP server connection string for emails
- `EMAIL_FROM`: Email address for sending password reset links
- `EXPO_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL`: Mobile app API endpoint (configured in app.config.ts)

**Mobile API Configuration**
- Base URL resolution: Environment variable  Expo config  Platform defaults
- Android emulator: 10.0.2.2:3000 (host loopback mapping)
- iOS simulator/web: localhost:3000
- Configurable via app.config.ts extra.apiBaseUrl field

import mongoose from 'mongoose';

const productSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  title: String,
  description: String,
  price: Number,
  originalPrice: Number,
  discount: Number,
  images: [String],
  category: String,
  brand: String,
  rating: Number,
  stock: Number,
  sizes: [String],
  colors: [String],
  reviews: [{
    user: String,
    rating: Number,
    comment: String,
    date: Date
  }],
  createdAt: { type: Date, default: Date.now }
});

const Product = mongoose.models.Product || mongoose.model('Product', productSchema);

const products = [

async function seedDatabase() {
  try {
    const MONGODB_URI = process.env.MONGODB_URI;
    
    if (!MONGODB_URI) {
      throw new Error('MONGODB_URI is not defined in environment variables');
    }

    console.log('Connecting to MongoDB...');
    await mongoose.connect(MONGODB_URI);
    console.log('Connected to MongoDB successfully');

    console.log('Clearing existing products...');
    await Product.deleteMany({});
    console.log('Existing products cleared');

    console.log('Inserting new products...');
    const inserted = await Product.insertMany(products);
    console.log(`Successfully inserted ${inserted.length} products`);

    console.log('\nProducts by category:');
    const categories = ['men', 'women', 'kids', 'footwear', 'accessories', 'beauty'];
    for (const category of categories) {
      const count = await Product.countDocuments({ category });
      console.log(`  ${category}: ${count} products`);
    }

    await mongoose.connection.close();
    console.log('\nDatabase seeding completed successfully!');
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error seeding database:', error);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

seedDatabase();
